meanings.definition: To take advantage of someone's generosity without giving anything in return.
meanings.sent1: She always freeloads off her friends by never offering to pay for anything.
meanings.sent2: He constantly freeloads off his parents, never contributing to household expenses.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel freeloads on the bird feeder, stealing seeds without planting any in return.
meanings.sent4: The lazy cat freeloads on the dog's food, sneaking bites when the dog isn't looking.
meanings.sent5: The roommate who freeloads on others' groceries is never invited to join shopping trips.

meanings.definition: A person who habitually takes advantage of others' generosity without giving anything in return.
meanings.sent1: She is known as the office freeloader, always taking credit for others' work.
meanings.sent2: The freeloader at the party ate all the snacks without bringing anything to share.
meanings.sent3: The freeloader at the potluck only brought an empty plate to take leftovers home.
meanings.sent4: The freeloader in the group project never contributes but still expects an A grade.
meanings.sent5: The freeloader in the dormitory always borrows without returning, earning a bad reputation.
